ARABIC: وَأَوْفُوا۟ ٱلْكَيْلَ إِذَا كِلْتُمْ وَزِنُوا۟ بِٱلْقِسْطَاسِ ٱلْمُسْتَقِيمِ ذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ وَأَحْسَنُ تَأْوِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Give full measure when you measure and weigh with a level balance. That is better and gives the best result.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Give full measure when you are measuring, and weigh on a balanced scale. This is better, and excellent its consequence.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (xii) Give full measure when you measure, and weigh with even scales. That is fair and better in consequence.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: While weighing, use proper measurements in the exchange of your property. This is fair and will be better in the end.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And correctly measure when you measure, and weigh correctly with the scales; this is better, and has a better outcome.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with a balance that is straight. That is good (advantageous) and better in the end.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And give full measure when you measure out, and weigh with a true balance; this is fair and better in the end.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And fill up the measure when you measure, and weigh with the straight balance; that is better and fairer in the issue.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Fill the measure when ye measure, and weigh with a right balance; that is meet, and better in the end.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Give full measure, when you measure, and weigh with accurate scales. That is fair, and better in the end.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And give full measures when ye measure and weigh with an even balance that is good, and the best interpretation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When you measure, observe fully the measure, [and] weigh with an even balance. That is better and more favourable with respect to the outcome [in the Hereafter].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Give full measure when ye measure, and weigh with a balance that is straight: that is the most fitting and the most advantageous in the final determination.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with a balance that is straight. That is good (advantageous) and better in the end.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Give full measure when you measure, and weigh with even scales. That is better, and fairer in the end.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with accurate scales. That is fair, and the best determination.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is the best [way] and best in result.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [17:35] And give full measure, complete it, when you measure, and weigh with a right balance, [with] an even balance: that is better and fairer in return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Fill the measure) perfect measurement (when ye measure) to others, (and weigh with a right balance) with a fair balance; (that) perfecting measurement and weighing and fulfilling one's pledge (is meet) is better than breaking covenants and cheating in measure, (and better in the end) in the end result.
